intro: Mentha longifolia subsp. schimperi, commonly known as Ethiopian spearmint, is a perennial herb native to the highlands of Ethiopia. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy and have a strong, aromatic scent. The plant produces small, pale blue or purple flowers arranged in whorls along the stems. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in mountainous regions with well-drained soil. Its essential oils, rich in menthol and other terpenes, make it valuable in both culinary and medicinal applications.
